author: Dan Strumpf
title: Lawmakers Say U.S. Tech Is Being Used in Abusive Chinese Crackdowns
text:
Two members of Congress are urging the Commerce Department to consider toughening export controls on U.S. companies whose technologies they say are being used for state surveillance of citizens in China that enables human rights abuses.
In a letter to Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross, Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida and Rep. Chris Smith of New Jersey, the Republican heads of the bipartisan Congressional-Executive Commission on China, ask whether the agency is “tracking the sale of equipment and technology by U.S. companies that...
